decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [EX01, EX02, PR01, PR02, PR03A, PR04]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 5 - No development shall occur until:
 
i) a preliminary risk-assessment has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

ii) a site-investigation has been conducted to consider the potential for contaminated-land and shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

iii) a remediation method statement, described to make the site suitable for, intended use by removing unacceptable risks to sensitive receptors, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation:
 
The remediation shall be completed and a verification report, produced on completion of the remediation, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:

i) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made with an agreed determination date.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.
